intro: Erodium althaeoides, commonly known as the narrow-leaf bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, pink to purple flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and coastal areas. It is an annual herb that produces small, capsule-like fruits containing several seeds. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
